item.title: Comment on Why Don’t We Have Flying Cars? by Dino Sauron
item.description:
If regulations were the constraining factor, preventing the development of flying cars in the United states, then we would see flying cars in some jurisdiction outside of the United States.

But we do not. Which leads to the conclusion that the constraining factor lies elsewhere.

IMO it is physics and energy. Imaginary flying cars levitate directly, they do not rely upon aerodynamic lift to become airborne. Which requires more concentrated energy than is viable with existing technology - and probably never will be available.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/why-dont-we-have-flying-cars.html?commentID=160808770

Post URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/why-dont-we-have-flying-cars.html?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=why-dont-we-have-flying-cars

Votes: 66⬆ 4⬇
item.dc:creator: Dino Sauron

item.title: Comment on Banning Airbnb in NYC by extramsg
item.description:
NYC has 120,000 hotel rooms
It has 2,300,000 residential rental units
It had 40,000 short term rentals (airbnbs)

40,000 units is less than 2% of the rental market but a third of the hotel market. The loss of those units affecting hotel prices bigly while not doing anything for rents should surprise no one.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/09/banning-airbnb-in-nyc.html?commentID=160808720
